intro: Wilcoxia albiflora, commonly known as the whiteflower desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the deserts of the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its basal rosette of silver-gray leaves and its tall, slender stem that bears a single, white flower. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with a deep root system that allows it to access underground water. Its flowers are pollinated by insects, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Wilcoxia albiflora is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss and environmental changes.
